Y6YoXLfNnPYLNjDzLfpVgA.text: Food was good but service pushy. They kinda drag you in from the sidewalk when they spy you reading the menu, then suggest all the most expensive items and start writing them on the order pad before you even agree to it.

tpjU3rpyqcZERmGoJMtxug.text: Had the deluxe meal for two. Horrible experience. The meat was dry. The curry was bland. The service was lethargic and disorganized (we had two separate people come to take our order)

e2YdssPXmPKf8d2nN9xguw.text: Nice restaurant with attentive staff and good food. I enjoyed it a great deal though my dining companion thought it left room for improvement. We mentioned we were staying at the Hotel Bailey (the concierge Raymond had recommended this place to us) and I still wonder if that was why we received such attentive service. Attentive is an understatement, we were treated like the only people there even though it was half full. No reservation and they welcomed us and seated us immediately. Walking distance to Gloucester Tube Station.

zhfzIml0YGWONJVVNWFXRw.text: Been around forever. Neighourhood trad Indian although we travel by tube to it. Good prices and really good food.

14WFH1UMc3j4TLduIKUS5w.text: We were hoping to eat some proper Indian food when we visited London this time and lucked into a recommendation of Memories of India. The restaurant is small but they do take reservations.  The food as fresh, delicious and served on warmers which keeps it all at a nice temperature as you graze if sharing with others. We were a party of 6 and noshed on some chips and dips to start and loved the traditional anise and sugar beads served at end of meal.  Very close to museum of natural history if you are on holiday.

photos.caption: Photo of Memories Of India - London, United Kingdom. Dips and menu to start
Photo of Memories Of India - London, United Kingdom. Anise mixture and chocolates at end of meal
Photo of Memories Of India - London, United Kingdom. Dinner is served!

cQ_He6jLGUtZ_QZcDz4Vhw.text: AMAZING FOOD & SERVICE!!! Best Indian I have ever had!! Staff was so accommodating and friendly! Ordered takeout and everything was absolutely delicious. Only regret is that I didn't find this place sooner! Thank you, Memories of India :)

WyAWcjB4VarQOt9l1T99ig.text: Came here for Christmas dinner, staff was very accommodating. The reviews were decent, but when we got our food, we found the food very flavorless. It didn't seem like there was much added to it. Not sure if in the UK Indian food is suppose to be bland, but I was told UK has the best Indian food. I was disappointed with the lack of flavor. The food seemed like it was cooked in a hurry and mass produced. The meal was also really pricey, we ended up with a $145 (US dollars) bill at the end of the night. Paying that much, I expected a lot more.

BVhG4nIE0hoaS8rMUi6Rcg.text: Food was great, presentation very very service, service was personal , tandoori is their best, A must see if you are in london , very reasonably price!!

photos.caption: Photo of Memories Of India - London, United Kingdom. Lamb tandoori and vegetable fried rice

4rbh_v8bIABm0RXOwG3H-A.text: Chicken Madras had all white chucks of meat, very flavorful.Veggie Side dishes were priced well for portion size.

2WjBISU3CRDOuBCWDEZdzw.text: 18 Gloucester Road London SW7 4RB - best Indian FoodEmily Rose Reeder

f2iygtPEbvBlHbw0Ikd9tg.text: Very clean.  Named a couple of proteins, prawns and lamb and server recommended some great dishes.  Sides of lemon rice and green beans with flat bread made an excellent first night in London Indian dinner!

pwXL9m5Rdi_hngcey0Zf2g.text: Memories defines it well. This place was 'eh'. The food was fine but not great. And the service was ok as we kept having to seek the waiters attention. The added issue is that they ended up charging in USD when we were ready to pay in pounds. Now I have a credit card issue. Frankly we will not be back.

gTrO6DzSr34UrSWEeUQKlQ.text: We were looking to have some Indian food during our visit to London but didn't have much selection in the area we were staying (high street Kensington).  We walked by this place earlier and checked it out on yelp and TA and decided to give it a try.  We showed up and we were greeted at the door and invited in, from that moment till we left, the service was unbelievable and by far the best service I've ever received in London!  The meal was exactly what we were looking for, great flavours nice selection and food was served quick and hot.  It was the best Indian food I've ever had but it was exactly what we were looking for and the service made it that much better!  Great job and thanks for a great meal.

SO9NrccS2sLX-bJleTZU2Q.text: Lamb Kabob was spectacular! Nice side dishes, too. Will be back! Clean, friendly and attentive wait staff.

xurb1Wz92uSn9elFwIyW5g.text: The food here was almost as good as Woodlands. For some reason I enjoyed the food there a bit more, but the service here was outstanding. Really fast, very friendly, and quick to clean up your table. I hate it when some waiters try to take the plate away before you are finished. I think this is more with NYC than with London, but these waiters were on the ball. They gave great advice, seated us right away, and went out of their way to get the door as we were leaving. For some reason I had the bug for Indian and both Memories of India and Woodlands did not disappoint. Also crowded which is good at times since there are other Indian restuarants nearby that were not as crowded.

XmlXC6wtSIIwfc6laVh_RA.text: I was rewly surprised after going here or dinner as a result of reading the racing reviews. It wasn't as good as I expected it to be. I'm of Indian decent visiting from San Francisco where we have many great restaurants. And usually yelp reviews always take me to the right place but I was definitely disappointed with the food here.

Kdd15zHMy74fGvMYkJ2rRw.text: I really wanted to love this place as my fellow yelpers had great things to say about it.  But I can't rave about my experience.  Very mediocre. The food was good but I've had better Indian food in Seattle.  The portions were a bit small but that's very typical of Indian restaurants so I'm not complaining.  The service was indeed extremely attentive (as noted by other yelpers), and almost too much so.  The waiter put the napkin in my husband's lap and picked up every crumb from the table immediately after we finished eating.  I feel like if the service is supposed to be so great, why do we have to buy water for 3.99?  The other part that I wasn't thrilled about was they kept trying to upsell us without making it clear what the prices were.  In America, many Indian restaurants bring you chappatti for free at the beginning of the meal.  Here they brought it at the beginning but then they charged for it.  They brought us two orders of rice without asking if we wanted them both.  The server tried to bring us mangos at the end of the meal.  When the check came, it  was so scribbled that it was hard to tell what we were paying for.  Was service charge included?  We couldn't tell and therefore tipped.  It felt like they were trying to get as much money out of us as possible while leaving us confused.There are several more indian restaurants in the same neighborhood and I will try a different one next time. Three stars for solid food though.

H8SkS3dRsi5x14AQQAatwA.text: Excellent food, excellent service. The waiters basically spoonfeed you.The decoration is really nicely done.Maybe the only criticism I could make is that the portions are a bit too small...

urLwkZ5PPzhvF7ZJTzVXRw.text: We visited from the San Francisco Bay Area and this was close to our apartment. Their service was great and I LOVE indian food and was not disappointed. They do not necessarily tell you what is "extra" and their bill is hand scribbled so you have to trust that it is correct. My husband had the lamb curry-it was "ok". The naan was great. I had the king prawn masala and loved it, although sweeter than normal, I loved it. They were wonderful with our toddler and had a little seat for her. Perfect night! Thanks for the great service.

jHM8EZr4qwJQOgTqiOKx9A.text: We had to wait for over an hour to be seated, but I guess that's what we get for not coming earlier. The restaurant is pretty small, though, for its popularity.After reading the menu we expected to spend twenty-some pounds for the two of us, maybe thirty, seeing as how we only wanted one dish each. When the check came, we saw that we were out over forty pounds. The waiters charge for EVERYTHING: chapati (which was pretty bad), rice, naan, everything. They will never actually tell you whether something is included or extra.

sptTKiALidQ0fQfDuKlR4A.text: I had heard that London had some exquisite Indian favors, and Memories of India brings them all together !  My concierge recommended this restaurant and I was very pleased.   Being a newcomer to Indian food, I asked the waiter for some recommendations.  He started us with a meat somosa and a vegetable somosa . It was good, but no competition to our main course.  The chicken mossala and lamb curry were excellent ! You can't beat good food in a great environment. I highly recommend Memories of India and plan to make this a regular stop on my future  visits to the  UK.

Tpkmdj_nep_Kl1DfhZyjKA.text: It is a typical small and simple Indian restaurant that serves a good variety of foods. The service is quick and attentive, although they try to upsell you sometimes. The quality of the food is excellent, better than at similarly priced Indian restaurants. It is not a destination place, but if you are in the area it is an excellent choice.

-uuEsNhwx0oC3YU5JnmgGw.text: Visitors to London,  we found ourselves at the Bailey Hotel  and asked the hotel concierge for his recommendation on good, unpretentious Indian food in the neighborhood, and Memories of India was one of his picks. The atmosphere was pleasantly warm and the wait staff friendly and welcoming. The menu was easy to navigate and if a question arose it was easily answered. We had a variety of classics and treated to a palette of wonderful flavors and taste bud sensations. The heat was there if wanted or not. I would recommend this establishment to anyone. We had a wonderful meal of that showcased a small portion of India.

gXQmKKsIGxE-iSE53hyctw.text: Memories of India has several spots around London.  This is the best Indian food I have had anywhere in the world.  I give the food here a 5++.  I have eaten at Memories of India probably 5 times and every time it exceeds my expectations.  The food melts in your mouth and every plate I have tried has been excellent.  I think about flying to London just to eat at this restaurant.

OtmxPiCQjysAG9WfT6N5AQ.text: Great dinner - nice little spot in Kensington for an American who loves good Indian food but can't get it at home.Wonderful service and staff too!

1EA4eugA8_PSwP5lIEY7aA.text: Incredible Indian food with the most friendliest service there is !   Surprisingly satisfying portions of simply the freshest tasting Indian food I have ever tried ! Enjoyed the pilau rice with mixed vegetable curry - Vindaloo Punjabi style !!  Most recommended and at very reasonable prices. Next time I am in London, I promise to return ;-)

Gvqzw9xgKPpNNbt25JuvKg.text: My partner and I had a distasteful experience and had to leave after sitting down for 15 minutes. We went during lunch hour, there was only 1 table at the restaurant so they were not busy by any means. The man that was supposed to be our server came over after we had been sitting down for a while. We gave him our drink orders, he left, and our drinks came out slowly. We then had to wait a bit longer for him to finally come back and take our order and once we told him what we wanted he basically snatched the menus out of our hands which was unprofessional to say the least. A little bit later a group walks in and they take a seat. They get their drinks and shortly after the server comes out with an appetizer, they have not ordered any food yet so my partner and I look at each other confused. At that moment we decided to walk away. The way we were treated left a bad taste in my mouth and unfortunately the only memories I will have of this place is of their unprofessional attitude.

photos.caption: Photo of Memories Of India - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Memories Of India - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Memories Of India - London, United Kingdom

N4szFIUdMVgH2_nPeUt9Pw.text: Fantastic food backed by efficient service makes for a great experience at Memories of India. We tried the tadka dal and palak paneer, alongwith accompaniments. All items were well prepared and very well balanced in terms of spices and taste. Reminded us of home cooked food. The service was prompt and efficient which is a big plus. We would  definitely like to visit again and strongly recommend  to anyone craving Indian food in this part of London. Great taste, at value for money prices.

LpmZsL6AKoa92C3uPt9nrQ.text: Blehck. In a city with such amazing Indian food there is no room for a mediocre place like this. Charming space - contemporary and simple but interesting decor. Horrid service. Seated immediately then nothing for 15 minutes. Sever very short with us. Seemed inconvenienced to be taking our order. Only one of us got water even after we asked. No one ever checked in after food served. Chicken was outright bad. Not cooked right. Bland. Paneer ok in the sense if being passable. Garlic naan was flavorless. Mango lassi mediocre. It's a tourist trap and not worth going to. Boo on them.

photos.caption: Photo of Memories Of India - London, United Kingdom. Interior

lKHWVfdsH45VEoFfFaVArA.text: Three weeks in a row I ate at this restaurant with colleagues of mine, we work for an airline and stay in the area. The first week, the food was delicious and service was friendly enough. Received a 20% discount because we arrived before 6:30.Second week I ate with one colleague. Wait staff seemed mildly annoyed the whole time. Food delicious and received 20% discount for arriving before 6:30. Third time, which was last night,  the wait staff was so grumpy and unfriendly. Never smile at us, but that's ok, I can handle it, the food is delicious. Waiter brings check and says " special airline discount " -- 15%. Hmmmmm. I didn't realize until much later which prompted me to write this review. (Trying to decipher the bill is hard enough because the handwriting is barely legible.)So now we will not return. There are plenty of other places to eat in the area that can treat us a little nicer and appreciate our business. I can't imagine why working for an airline subjects you to less than the rest of your customers.

yBNqZQ7SkXkbGBwgaLddTg.text: We were recommended this resteraunt from a friend. Unfortunately it was just ok. Your typical unremarkable Indian food. Everything was edible no glaring mistakes but nothing to write home about either.

QzqXN9e1ug4f_knYNhAEkQ.text: Had a lovely dinner here! Staff was warm, friendly, and prompt. Food was wonderful -- the best Indian food I have had in a long time. Would highly recommend the Mango lassi and chicken korma! Can't wait to come back!

x-UmaGpDfPhiqkEagzFfOQ.text: I had a wonderful dinner tonight with another airline buddy - (they offer a discount - and also have a 20% discount as well for everyone else from about 4-6:30pm) we just let the very friendly waiter choose for us since it was our first time here and he came through with a very nice selection of chicken tika, a nice cucumber and tomato and onion salad, basmati rice, prawns, a spinach dish, and wonderful naan - oh yes and two giant Indian beers - all for about 44 pounds after discount. I'll be back here for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Memories Of India - London, United Kingdom

v2E4r85A2QlcV1lQtYS8PQ.text: Delicious Indian meal in Kensington, the place is small, but the staff is super nice and very attentive. We had a 5 year old with us for dinner and they did all they could to be nice to her and entertain her during our meal (she loved the food too)Value for money, this is definitely a good place to go, again food was delicious, service was great and the bill wasnt crazy..

ZqH1811PmYNURzkZQtSNMw.text: Well it's helpful we were here right at opening (just arrived in London) so we felt like VIPs being alone on the restaurant however the staff treated us like VIPS as well. The food was excellent with very distinguished and identifiable spices differentiating each dish. The peshwari naan was a nice surprise and was really good their take on chicken Tikka Masala was good although unbelievably mild per my daughters request the chicken murgh jalfrezi was appropriately spiced medium. Desert was a diverse offering of Indian to American with even some tiramisu thrown in for good measure.

JIdx4uY_NPSzxnYJS3rIwg.text: Probably some of the best Indian food I have had anywhere!  Just wish there was a little more of it in the servings; which is why this is a 4 Star and not 5.  The chicken and lamb were cooked to perfection and the murgh tikka masala was absolutely superb. Highly recommended.

KTlvNnf1Fb4babONFy3gIg.text: We've had many Indian meals at a variety of restaurants in the States and also during our trip to London. Memories of India has a unique way of presenting Indian classic dishes and experimenting with new twists. The sauces are so subtle and delicate they are unlike anything I've ever tasted. The service was very good. We arrived before the dinner rush on Sunday. Glad we came to Kensington and found Memories of India. Kudos to Imi for running a fabulous spot.

AwFCuKpGZeuueXFNTrSC0A.text: Cute atmosphere and friendly and welcoming staff! Nice menu to choose from and the service was great! Ask for Imran- he was my waiter and very attentive! I had the chicken tikka masala,rice and okra bhindi! Loved the food and they put a cute little heating platter on your table to keep your meal warm the whole time you are dining! Enjoyed my delicious meal as London is known for their outstanding Indian food and this is the place to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Memories Of India - London, United Kingdom. Tasty condiments and crispy papadum! If you come  between 4:30-6:30 pm M-F they have 20%. Off your meal and happy hour!
Photo of Memories Of India - London, United Kingdom. Lovely food!
Photo of Memories Of India - London, United Kingdom. Chicken tikka masala!

dO8yNgn14lovMP9NBtzqZQ.text: Check bill as they overcharge.     Food was ok, small portions.     We noticed they overcharged us on some items.     They corrected bill when we brought it to their attention.    I don't think this was a mistake as other reviews of their sister restaurant, Little India, 2 doors down had similar overcharging.

c6cbQ0Ch1k-rUxic8-FYOQ.text: Indian food was so so great but service was even better. Staff was so hospitable and caring, we got a 20% student discount, complimentary salad and hot towels and chocolate at the end! Highly recommend

EAujx9mkp21z6XEVdgliYQ.text: Proper Indian food at a reasonable price! Food exceeded expectations which is a great compliment coming from an Indian. Staff is courteous and service is excellent. They provide a complimentary salad and pickle that  you would find in India . All in all great value for money. Highly recommended.

4WfR6KgFD8gQ88keMm2B0w.text: Above average Indian food.  Service is just awful. Our waiter seemed totally uninterested in serving us. It was as if we were keeping him from doing something of true importance.Watch out for the "discretionary" 10% tip. They slip it in and look the other way. That sort of thing is bad business. The U.K. really needs to stop the encroachment of these tips before it becomes a tipping quagmire like the U.S.

JHKkFrhzUl7W7Y8pjtVTaA.text: Food allergic consumers: DO NOT EAT HERE. I put my allergy on my reservation in open table, told the waiter immediately upon arrival of a severe allergy, clarified with every dish, and asked again once we finished placing the whole order. I was told "do not worry about this, there won't be any in your food." We get our food, I take a few bites... immediately my throats swells, itches, and I develop hives. My boyfriend flags down the waitstaff and angrily asks wtf we asked more than 4 times. The server nonchalantly tells us that one of the dishes contains my allergen, oh and they garnish the rice with it.... as if this should have been obvious. Then tells me he will get me something else... as if I could eat now and as if that would fix an anaphylactic allergy... If you're severely allergic to anything, this is not the place for you.

K1DWDh5rBbbua7h-Hoovyg.text: They really cant call this Indian food.. Everything tastes super sweet and they had the nerve to say this is how Indian food is suppose to taste.. LolThis is completely catered to western pallet.. Stay away if you are looking for Authentic Indian..
